text:
Hi.

Right now one has to set
ProxyPassReverseCookieDomain internal-domain public-domain

This breaks as soon as ServerAliases are used since one can only give one public domain.

When public-domain is ommited, it should automatically determine it each time, depending on the hostname used in the client request.


Cheers,
Chris.


btw: Can't you switch the ordering of internal-domain public-domain to match that oft the other reverse proxy directives, i.e. first the external name, then the internal/reverse name?
